meanings.definition: To sell at a lower price than a competitor.
meanings.sent1: The store tried to outprice its rival by offering discounts.
meanings.sent2: She managed to outprice the other seller by reducing her rates.
meanings.sent3: The race to outprice each other led to a price war between the two companies.
meanings.sent4: His determination to outprice everyone else made him the go-to option for budget shoppers.
meanings.sent5: In the end, the strategy to outprice the competition paid off with increased sales.

meanings.definition: To offer a lower price than someone else.
meanings.sent1: To attract more customers, the company decided to outprice its competitors.
meanings.sent2: They were able to outprice their opponents due to their efficient cost management.
meanings.sent3: The plan to outprice the market backfired when customers questioned the quality of the product.
meanings.sent4: By consistently outpricing others, the small business gained a loyal customer base.
meanings.sent5: The decision to outprice the competition was a risky move that paid off in the long run.
